TopicTitle: Please delete or close this thread!

Articles.Content:
Oh, you think Jool Five is hard? Wait 'til you hear this!

I challenge you to venture from Kerbin to Eve, land, and return. But that's not all! You have to use HyperEdit to move Kerbin to Moho's position but in a 90Ã‚Âº orbit. And also move Eve to Eeloo's position in a 0Ã‚Âº retrograde orbit. I know this is kinda cruel, but whatever. You can use ore to refuel, or any other ISRU mod. But you cannot use any cheaty mods like KSPI, USI Warp Drive, debug cheats, excessive TweakScale usage (this doesn't mean you can't use it though), or editing config files. Oh also, don't forget to bring a cupola module. NO USING HYPEREDIT FOR CHEATING PURPOSES!!!!!!!!!!!

There are three tiers like in Jool Five, the first being actually making the trip without breaking the rules. The second is that you did it in a single launch and didn't use docking plus the 1st tier. And the third is actually either of the first two if you use TAC life support.

If you make it, please post a picture of your mission below! Good Luck!

Edited May 31, 2015 by hieywiey

Impossible.

Is this challenge possible?

Many challenges we see are nearly or literally impossible to achieve, and usually very little thought has gone into them, these challenges just annoy people, waste forum space and show that the submitter hasn't really tried.

So test your challenge yourself first to make sure it is possible, you don't have to be successful but you'll soon know if the challenge has a hope of being completed.
Not if you try the obearth effect (Screw spelling) and higher inclination burns you can do this in 1358 parts! (yea..... lag sucks better than the 2543 it whould've took in .90)
This is trivial. Just bomb internet servers until the KSP forum breaks.

Nope.

LOL I just read the invisible text.
